Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; below, two white bands; exterior reserved; graffito inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on the exterior surface of the sherd may be a result of the sherd's size. The decoration on the exterior surface of Simple Animal Style vases is not usually extensive and filling ornament, with the exception of a simple rim pattern, a single elaborate rosette and simple handle zone pattern, is absent.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0983) (phase 2)
